{{also|Laut|ļaut}} ==Basque== ===Noun=== {{eu-noun}} # [[lute]] ---- ==Brunei Malay== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|kxd|/laut/}} * {{hyph|kxd|la|ut}} ===Noun=== {{head|kxd|noun}} # [[sea]] {{gloss|body of water}} [[Category:kxd:Geography]] ---- ==Estonian== ===Etymology=== From {{der|et|gem-pro|*lautō}}, {{m|gem-pro|*lautiz}}. Compare {{cog|non|laut}} and {{cog|gmq-osw|lȫt}}. Cognate to {{cog|vot|lautta}} ===Noun=== {{et-noun|lauda|lauta}} # [[barn]] # [[stable]] ====Declension==== {{et-decl-leib|laut|laud|a}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|goh|lūt}}, akin to Old Saxon ''hlūd'', from {{der|de|gem-pro|*hlūdaz}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*ḱlew-}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/laʊ̯t/}} * {{audio|de|De-laut.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-laut.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Adjective=== {{de-adj|lauter|lautesten}} # [[loud]], [[noisy]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-adj|laut|lauter|lautest}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|leise}} ===Preposition=== {{head|de|preposition}} (+ ''dative or genitive'') # [[according to]] ====Usage notes==== The preposition ''laut'' governs either the dative or genitive case. Usage with dative has been more common since 1900: :* '''''laut''' einem Bericht (also: eines Berichts)'' — '''according to''' a report. The dative case is always used for plural nouns not preceded by an article, determiner, or adjective: :* '''''laut''' Berichten (not: Berichte)'' — '''according to''' reports. An isolated noun of the strong declension remains uninflected in the singular: :* '''''laut''' Bericht (not: Berichts)'' — '''according to''' the report. ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|lt.}} ===Verb=== {{head|de|verb form}} # {{lb|de|also|_|Early New High German|rare after that period|now archaic}} {{inflection of|de|lauten||3|s|pres|indc}}; {{alternative form of|de|lautet}} [[Category:de:Sound]] ---- ==Icelandic== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|is|/ˈløyːt/}} * {{rhymes|is|øyːt}} ===Noun=== {{is-noun|f|lautar|lautir}} # [[hollow]], [[depression]] ====Declension==== {{is-decl-noun-f-s2|l|au|t}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|hollow}} {{l|is|lægð}}, {{l|is|dæld}}, {{l|is|gróf}} ---- ==Indonesian== ===Etymology=== From {{der|id|ms|laut}}, from {{der|id|poz-mly-pro|*laut}} (compare {{cog|ms|laut}}), from {{der|id|poz-pro|*lahud}} (compare {{cog|ilo|laud||west}}), from {{der|id|map-pro|*lahud}}. ===Noun=== {{id-noun}} # [[sea]] {{gloss|body of water}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|id |{{l|id|kelautan}} |{{l|id|lautan}} |{{l|id|melaut}} |{{l|id|melauti}} |{{l|id|melautkan}} |{{l|id|pelaut}} |{{l|id|pelautan}} }} [[Category:id:Geography]] ---- ==Kapampangan== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|pam|poz-pro|*lahud}} (compare {{cog|ilo|laud||west}}), from {{inh|pam|map-pro|*lahud}}. ===Noun=== {{pam-noun}} # [[gulf]] # [[deep]] [[sea]] ---- ==Malay== ===Etymology=== From {{der|ms|poz-mly-pro|*laut}} (compare {{cog|id|laut}}), from {{der|ms|poz-pro|*lahud}} (compare {{cog|ilo|laud||west}}), from {{der|ms|map-pro|*lahud}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|Johor-Selangor}} {{IPA|ms|/laot/}} * {{a|Riau-Lingga}} {{IPA|ms|/laʊt/}} * {{rhymes|ms|aot|ot}} ===Noun=== {{ms-noun|j=لاءوت|pl=-}} # [[sea]] {{gloss|body of water}} [[Category:ms:Geography]] ---- ==Norwegian Nynorsk== ===Verb=== {{head|nn|verb form}} # {{inflection of|nn|lyta||past}} ---- ==Sundanese== ===Romanization=== {{su-rom}} # {{romanization of|su|ᮜᮅᮒ᮪}} ---- ==Veps== ===Etymology=== Related to Finnish {{m|fi|lautta}}. ===Noun=== {{head|vep|noun}} # [[raft]] ---- ==Westrobothnian== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmq-bot|gem-pro|*lautō}}. ===Noun=== {{head|gmq-bot|noun|g=f}} # [[farmyard|Farmyard]]; [[place]], [[space]], [[land]], outside and at the cowshed, where the cattle can freely go to and fro, and from where they are driven to the pasture; [[cowpath]] next to the cowshed. ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|gmq-bot|lȯit}} * {{l|gmq-bot|lawt}} * {{l|gmq-bot|leut}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|gmq-bot|laut-tå}} ====See also==== * {{l|gmq-bot|hɑlöut}}
